content.description: Really good climb!  Sit start on the overhanging side of the arete with hands on a good sidepull, left foot arete, right foot on the huge block.  Pull up to a crimp on the opposite face, (try to avoid the real hollow flake, it's gonna blow soon, I purposely didn't use it) move some feet.  Hit the dish on the edge of the arete, grab the real cool undercling/sidepull (great move)reach for the top.  I topped out over the overhanging side, made more sense, but you could probably go up the other side, might be a little easier.  Walk off.  Watch the branches!
content.location: Cross the Tree Farm gate and go left about 100 yards, it's right there facing the road.

content.description: Climb the wide crack all the way right, past the tree.  Thought it looked like a fat, short Ride The Lightning...well... it sort of has the same shape, sorta. Anyway it's fun in flip flops that don't fit really well!  I'll get a pic so I can be laughed at.
content.protection: Pad if you think a fall into leaves wouldn't be fun!  Just like when I was young...
content.location: All the way right on the Broken Heart Boulder.

content.description: Are you taller than me? 5'7".  Then it's probably a V1-, shorter? A V2.  Start on the left hand shelf and instead of going right, go straight up on crimps, two little ones for us shorter folks, or a little and a big for you tall folk.  Top out straight up next to the main crack.  Look for a cool hold on the top you can't see from below.
content.location: The Broken Heart Boulder, far left shelf.  Park at the gate and walk left, a little easier to walk through the "field" and then back.  About 300 yards left of the gate.

content.description: Start at the Left hand shelf (same as for Cross My Heart)  Instead of finishing the Cross traverse, finish up the main crack (Heart Burn), makes the V0 much more interesting.  A real fun first few moves.
content.location: Park at the gate and walk left, a little easier to walk through the "field" and then back.  About 300 yards left of the gate. The Broken Heart Boulder, far left side.

content.description: Start on the far left of the Broken Heart Boulder on a low shelf.  Traverse right on jugs into the blunt arete. Get a good left and stand tall to a small right hand crimp.  Get a high foot and reach high with the left to a mono sidepull, crux.  Go right to a good sidepull crimp, balance, feet up, get the top.
content.location: Far left of the broken heart boulder.

content.description: Easy route. Start with feet on a small shelf and hands on the first major hold above it. Make your way across and up the crack. Topping out can be sketchy with all the debris from trees above since it’s at a downward angle. Just keep that in mind.
content.location: Left side of cross my heart boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the huge shelf in the main crack of the Broken Heart, feet on the slopers.  Go straight up the crack on some interesting holds, top out.
content.protection: Pad, sandy landing minus 1 small rock
content.location: The center of the Broken Heart Boulder.  Park at the gate and walk left, a little easier to walk through the "field" and then back.  About 300 yards left of the gate.

content.description: Far right side of the boulder.  A little slabby fun!  Start one hand on the "Smile" and one low on a shelf.  Or both low, maybe a little easier, or both on the Smile, a lot harder.  Make a hard leap move to a flake, move feet around(crux). Finish up the real slabby top, super fun!
content.location: Right side of the Broken Heart Boulder.  Park at the gate and walk left, a little easier to walk through the "field" and then back.  About 300 yards left of the gate.

content.description: Hang on the good shelf all the way to left side of the main face of The Broken Heart Boulder.  Pull right to the start of the V0 "Heart Burn." (try to avoid the rock near your feet) I originally started here and added the longer start right after I did it once.  Cross the shelves.  Make a hard couple moves across the fairly blank white stripe to gain the next shelf (crux, awesome!)  Finish up the V1 "Another Little Piece."    Could be a reeeeally hard dyno above the crux on this.  If thats something your into have at it.  Looks easier than Blaow but not by a whole lot.
content.location: Park at the gate and walk left, a little easier to walk through the "field" and then back.  About 300 yards left of the gate.

content.description: Start on the Big shelf 10 feet right of the center crack. (sit start possible?)  Climb straight up on crimps to a slopey topout.
content.location: The Broken Heart Boulder, far right big shelf. Park at the gate and walk left, a little easier to walk through the "field" and then back.  About 300 yards left of the gate.

content.description: Saw these boulders in the winter and finally checked them out. Anyone climbed these before?  Putting me and my friend as the FA's for now. Barely needed any scrubbing!  There's one real good boulder with quality rock and 5 or 6 routes; one descent boulder with alright quality rock with (at least one) great problem.  Potential on a few other boulders, a P'way Balance Boulder look alike with a mushroom looking traverse on top, not sure of the quality, would have tried it with a spotter to move the pad, if anyone's up for it let me know! Another potential but has a tree in front of the problem.  Worth stopping by if your in the area.
